tourBios.otherCarHigh: Played college golf at Duke University, where he was a two-time GCAA All-American, a three-time Golfweek All-American and two-time All-ACC… Won the 2008 Wolfpack Invitational by defeating Webb Simpson on the second hole of a sudden death playoff in April. Also shared medalist honors at the 2008 Gator Invitational in February… Shot an NCAA tournament record setting 10-under par 60 at the 2007 NCAA Championship at the Golden Horseshoe in Williamsburg, Va. Had a 15-foot putt for a 59 but burned the edge of the cup. He is one of five college golfers to shoot a 60 in an NCAA-sanctioned event, joining Daniel Summerhays (BYU), Brock Mackenzie (Washington), Bryce Molder (Georgia Tech) and Paul Casey (Arizona State)… Attended Libertyville High School, where he was a four-year letterwinner. Won 17 tournaments during high school and got to be ranked 10th junior player in the United States… Named the Illinois Junior Golf Association Junior Player of the Year in 2002.
tourBios.personal: Has been a student of Dr. Jim Suttie at Cog Hill G&CC since age 4...Says "Gladiator" is his all-time favorite movie. Likes a variety of music, including hip-hop. Lists Jay-Z and Li'l Wayne as two of his favorites. Says he would probably be working in a sports management capacity if he weren't playing golf...Has a younger sister, Nicole, who played golf at Florida. She now works in tournament operations for the PGA TOUR...Has a Bernese mountain dog named Lacey.

tourBios.carHigh: Has played in two PGA TOUR events. His first came as an amateur at the 2006 Cialis Western Open. He also played in the 2009 HP Byron Nelson Championship. He missed the cut in both events. Has mainly played on the Hooters, Gateway and eGolf tours since turning pro.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Shot a 10-under 60 in the third round of the NCAA Championship at Golden Horseshoe in Williamsburg, VA. Had a 15-foot putt for a 59 but burned the edge of the cup. He is one of five college golfers to shoot a 60 in an NCAA-sanctioned event, joining Daniel Summerhays (BYU), Brock Mackenzie (Washington), Bryce Molder (Georgia Tech) and Paul Casey (Arizona State).
tourBios.personal: Has been a student of Dr. Jim Suttie at Cog Hill G&CC since age 4...Says "Gladiator" is his all-time favorite movie. Likes a variety of music, including hip-hop. Lists Jay-Z and Li'l Wayne as two of his favorites. Says he would probably be working in a sports management capacity if he weren't playing golf...Has a younger sister, Nicole, who played golf at Florida. She now works in tournament operations for the PGA TOUR...Has a Bernese mountain dog named Lacey.

tourBios.carHigh: 2014: Finished T9 at Canada's Q-School with 72-69-70-72 in May. Made three cuts in nine events with best outing a T23 at the Bayview Place Island Savings Open.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T41st in 2010 at the Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open.
